channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Oasis says reunion tour tickets can only be resold at face value on official sites
item.description: Ticket prices for the U.K. tour have skyrocketed on resale sites since presale started Friday. The British rock band said tickets offered on the secondary market will be voided.
item.content:encoded:
Ticket prices for the U.K. tour have skyrocketed on resale sites since presale started Friday. The British rock band said tickets offered on the secondary market will be voided.

(Image credit: Oli Scarff)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Over 17 million airline passengers head out for the busiest Labor Day weekend ever
item.description: This weekend caps a record-breaking season for travel, and those hitting the road will find lower gas prices than they did last year.
item.content:encoded:
This weekend caps a record-breaking season for travel, and those hitting the road will find lower gas prices than they did last year.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Mississippi bus crash kills 7 and injures 37
item.description: Seven people were killed and dozens were injured in Mississippi after a commercial bus overturned on Interstate 20 on Saturday morning. The bus was traveling near Bovina in Warren County.
item.content:encoded:
Seven people were killed and dozens were injured in Mississippi after a commercial bus overturned on Interstate 20 on Saturday morning. The bus was traveling near Bovina in Warren County.

(Image credit: WAPT)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As polio vaccinations begin in Gaza, U.N. says success hinges on a pause in fighting
item.description: Health care workers plan to reach more than 640,000 Palestinian children in a matter of days while Israel has agreed to staggered pauses in fighting.
item.content:encoded:
Health care workers plan to reach more than 640,000 Palestinian children in a matter of days while Israel has agreed to staggered pauses in fighting.

(Image credit: Jihad Al-Sharafi)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Children in Gaza who need medical care are not being allowed to evacuate, say aid groups
item.description: Aid groups that help families get a sick or injured child to another country for care say obtaining approval from Israel for the child and an adult companion to leave has become intensely difficult.
item.content:encoded:
Aid groups that help families get a sick or injured child to another country for care say obtaining approval from Israel for the child and an adult companion to leave has become intensely difficult.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: 7 U.S. troops hurt in Iraq raid targeting Islamic State group militants that killed 15
item.description: The U.S. military and Iraq launched a joint raid targeting suspected Islamic State group militants that killed at least 15 people and saw seven U.S. troops hurt, officials said.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. military and Iraq launched a joint raid targeting suspected Islamic State group militants that killed at least 15 people and saw seven U.S. troops hurt, officials said.

(Image credit: â€Ž)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Harris, Walz campaign in battleground of Georgia. Here's what it means for Trump
item.description: We look at how Vice President Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, are campaigning in the battleground state of Georgia, and what former President Trump will have to do to win back the state.
item.content:encoded: We look at how Vice President Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, are campaigning in the battleground state of Georgia, and what former President Trump will have to do to win back the state.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Why the U.S. isn't ready for wars of the future, according to experts
item.description: These experts argue technological developments have changed warfare more in the past several years than the decades spanning from the introduction of the airplane.
item.content:encoded:
These experts argue technological developments have changed warfare more in the past several years than the decades spanning from the introduction of the airplane.

(Image credit: Anton Petrus)
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Too hot for trout: Why some anglers are rethinking their approach to fly fishing
item.description: As Western Montana's blue-ribbon trout waters warm due to climate change, anglers are increasingly wrestling with the ethics of their sport.
item.content:encoded:
As Western Montana's blue-ribbon trout waters warm due to climate change, anglers are increasingly wrestling with the ethics of their sport.

(Image credit: Jonny Armstrong)
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: In 'Miss Merkel,' Germany's former chancellor is a crime-solving amateur detective
item.description: The German crime fiction series, based on novels of the same name, depicts former Chancellor Angela Merkel as an Agatha Christie-style small-town detective who solves crimes out of sheer boredom.
item.content:encoded:
The German crime fiction series, based on novels of the same name, depicts former Chancellor Angela Merkel as an Agatha Christie-style small-town detective who solves crimes out of sheer boredom.

(Image credit: RTL)
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson
